availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James M. Sandifer (Somerset, Kentucky, dentist and police judge)

body.p: Somerset, Kentucky, dentist and police judge. Kentucky native. Married to Cynthia Carson Sandifer. Father of Jane Sandifer, Sallie Sandifer, Elizza P. Sandifer, and George R. Sandifer. Dentist in Somerset in 1860. Police judge in Somerset in 1864.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pulaski County, Somerset, p. 4; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Pulaski County, Somerset, p. 9; Stanford Interior Journal (Stanford, Ky.), August 23, 1872, p. 1; Find A Grave, "James M. Sandifer (1828-1891)," Memorial #16414194, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=16414194&ref=acom (accessed May 25, 2017).
